snippet: A two-ton marble mosaic panel depicting Hercules sailing past the Rock of Gibraltar has been donated to the Newark Museum and will go on view in a courtyard.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Art Deco marble mosaic designed by Hildreth Meiere that once occupied the Prudential Insurance office tower in Newark, NJ, has been donated to the Newark Museum and will be on view in October; collection of drawings by newspaper cartoonists amassed by railroad executive and inventor Charles L Howard will be auctioned by Hess Fine Auctions in St Petersburg, Fla; lives and works of book illustrators Maud and Miska Petersham are being celebrated in new book and exhibit at the Woodstock Artists Association and Museum.
lead_paragraph: A two-ton marble mosaic panel depicting Hercules sailing past the Rock of Gibraltar has been donated to the Newark Museum and will go on view in a courtyard.

headline.seo: Newark Museum to Exhibit Hercules Mosaic Panel
headline.main: Two-Ton Hercules Mosaic, Rock Steady in Newark
